summary: The Safe Shelters Act of 2025 prohibits covered sex offenders from entering or using undesignated emergency shelters. It mandates that sex offenders must notify shelter operators if they enter an undesignated shelter and directs the operator to inform them of designated shelters. FEMA is authorized to designate specific federal buildings or prisons as shelters for these offenders during disasters. Violations of the prohibition can result in fines and imprisonment.
